result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Jeremy L. Tompkins was found guilty of Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Jeremy L. Tompkins was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

timeConds.notes:
1 year in the Pepin County Jail with huber privileges.  6 months stayed on the following conditions:  no possession or consumption of alcohol; no violations of law or probation; complete 150 hrs. of community service within the first 2 years of probation.  Jail sentence may be served in Clark County if without cost to Pepin County and is not electronic monitoring.
Concurrent with: Count 2

Referred to Buffalo-Pepin Counties Criminal Justice Coordinating Council for completing 150 hours of community service.  Identify the project and have it approved by the CJCC coordinator.  Complete all hours by 04-21-2017 with minimum of 10 hours per month.
AMENDED 03-07-2016:  Defendant terminated from the Community Service Program with CJCC.  Defendant to report project and service to the Department of Corrections and have all hours completed by 04-21-2017.
Concurrent with: Count 2

Discharge Certificate.   Effective April 24, 2020, discharged from judgment only.
Civil rights restored:  1)Right to Vote.  2)Obligations for jury duty.
Civil rights not restored:  1)Firearms may not be used or possessed unless a pardon, which does not restrict possession of firearms, is received from the governer.  2)Public office can not be held unless a pardon is obtained from the governor.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jeremy L. Tompkins in court.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion to Revoke Stay of Jail.  Condition of stay was defendant complete community service.  Defendant was terminated from C/S in February.  State requests stay be lifted and defendant serve the 6 months jail.  Defendant wishes to proceed w/o an Atty.  Defendant requests 1 chance and will get the C/S completed, committed to doing it here with the wrestling program.  Court won't revoke stay of jail.  Defendant to report service and project to the DOC and have it completed by 4/21/17.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jeremy L. Tompkins in court with attorney Lars Helmer Loberg.   Jon D. Seifert   Judge advises defendant of elements of count 1 & 2/max. penalties; felony conviction prohibitions.  Defendant pleads on count 1 & 2.  Court reviews PLQ/WOR form. Court finds defendant's waiver of his constitutional rights & plea done knowingly & voluntarily, accepts plea and finds defendant guilty of count 1 & 2, dismiss count 3 and 14TR417, 14TR418, 14TR419.  Sentence not to be processed until friday.  Court withholds sentence on count 1 & 2 and places defendant on 5 yrs. probation concurrent with eachother.  Conditions:  1 year in the Pepin County Jail, may serve in Clark County if w/o cost to Pepin Co. & is not electronic monitoring.  Good time on OWI, not on fleeing.  Court stays 6 mos. jail on the following conditions:  no possession or consumption of alcohol; no violations of law or probation; 150 hrs. community service w/in the first 2 yrs. of probation.  Operating privileges revoked for 6 mos. on count 1, 24 mos. on count 2; on count 2 credit for any admin. suspension; comply with IID 24 mos.; AA & comply with DSP; fine @ $1744 on count 2; provide DNA sample; costs on count 1 $268, no DNA surcharge on count 1, only count 2.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 04-21-2015 09:00 am

Defendant Jeremy L. Tompkins in court.  Attorney Lars Helmer Loberg appeared by phone means.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties reach an agreement, set PLEAS for Feb.  Court informs the parties, immediate report to jail.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 23, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on December 1, 2014 at 12:45 pm.

Defendant Jeremy L. Tompkins in court with attorney Lars Helmer Loberg.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises defendant of elements of each count as stated in the Information & max. penalties and advises defendant of his constitutional rights.  Defendant pleads not guilty to all counts.  Counsel requests STC, parties working on a plea agrmt.  Matter to be scheduled @ 60 days out.  Bond cont'd.

Defendant Jeremy L. Tompkins in court with attorney Lars Helmer Loberg.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waiver form filed with the court.  Defendant waives right to P.H., bound over for trial.  DA files Information.
